hi..just intalled ubuntu 10.10...tryin' to update software..it's asking for a password..and not accepting the account password..plz help is it asking for the root password? if yes then i did not give any root password while installation..what to do next plz hlp!!!
boot into single user mode, run passwd, set the root password, profit.
append single to the kernel params
bro..i'm new to ubuntu..u have to guide me really slow!!..plz explain in detail
i'm not getting the grub screen during boot!! i have windows XP as a another install..
hmm so there's no grub menu at all?  Does it say grub loading or anything and have a countdown?
gives a couple of of options like da link dat u gave me rite nw..
so, when you see that screen, highlight the ubuntu kernel you want, hit e, then find the kernel line and hit e again, then type " single" that's it.
i tried the way u said..but in the editor the edit "sinlge" is not accepting..its taking me to the next line..
you pressed e, typed " single", then hit enter, then hit b and it didn't work?
after you hit e and type single and hit enter hit b
plz b onlibe fr me a bit..
i enteren the GNU GRUB..but after i entered single..hit enter..but b then was again taking me to the next line..nothin' was being accepted
